greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of types of (n-1)-swap moves for traveling salesman problem. Number of circular permutations on elements 0,1,...,2n-1 where every two elements 2i,2i+1 and no two elements 2i-1,2i are adjacent.
comment: An n-swap move consists of the removal of n edges and addition of n different edges which result in a new tour. The type can be characterized by how the n segments of the original tour formed by the removal are reassembled.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
Helsgaun, Keld, General k-opt submoves for the Lin-Kernighan TSP heuristic, Math. Program. Comput. 1, No. 2-3, 119-163 (2009).
mathematica: m = 18; CoefficientList[ Series[ Exp[-x]*(1 - Log[1-2x]/2), {x, 0, m}], x]*Range[0, m]! (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 25 2011, after g.f. *)
program: (PARI) { for (n=0, 100, a=(-1)^n + sum(i=0, n-1, (-1)^(n-1-i)*binomial(n, i+1)*i!*2^i); write("b061714.txt", n, " ", a) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 26 2009
results.author: _David Applegate_, Jun 21 2001
